attributes.action: A legal challenge should be made against the recent EU Referendum Result
attributes.additional_details: It is our belief that the result would have been significantly different had this lie not been told. The result is therefore fraudulent and flawed and a re-run of the election should be allowed, and those responsible prosecuted for election fraud.
attributes.background: The 'Leave' campaigners clearly used a slogan stating that they intended to give £350 million to the NHS every week. Since the result they have gone back on this critical promise, stating that they will not be doing so. Many people will have voted for the 'Leave' camp based upon this lie and fraud.

rejection.details:
Legal challenges are a matter for the courts. The courts are independent of Government and Parliament. If you want to find out more about judicial review, the process by which acts of public bodies are reviewed for compliance with the law, see:

https://www.judiciary.gov.uk/you-and-the-judiciary/judicial-review/
